revised_title: Geochemical Reactions and Thermal History of Buried Sediments in Nova Scotia
tldr: This study models the burial and thermal histories of sediments deposited on the continental margin off Nova Scotia to predict the timing and location of petroleum generation. The authors use numerical models to calculate the temperature dependence of geochemical reactions involving steroid hydrocarbons and compare these predictions with observed reaction extents in sediment samples. The results provide insights into the temperature history of the sediments and the reactions affecting sedimentary organic matter, contributing to a better understanding of petroleum generation.
